org.apache.juneau.json

Class JsonParserBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.ContextBuilder
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContextBuilder
        • org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserBuilder
          • org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParserBuilder
            • org.apache.juneau.json.JsonParserBuilder

  • public class JsonParserBuilder
extends ReaderParserBuilder
    Builder class for building instances of JSON parsers.

      • validateEnd

        public JsonParserBuilder validateEnd(boolean value)
        Configuration property: Validate end.

        If true, after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.

        See Also:
        • JsonParser.JSON_validateEnd
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        The default value is false.

      • beanClassVisibility

        public JsonParserBuilder beanClassVisibility(Visibility value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Minimum bean class visibility.

        Classes are not considered beans unless they meet the minimum visibility requirements.

        For example, if the visibility is PUBLIC and the bean class is protected, then the class will not be interpreted as a bean class and will be treated as a string.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanClassVisibility
        Overrides:
        beanClassVisibility in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        The default is Visibility.PUBLIC.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • beanFilters

        public JsonParserBuilder beanFilters(boolean append,
                                     Object... values)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Bean filters.

        Same as BeanContextBuilder.beanFilters(Object...) but allows you to optionally overwrite the previous value.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters
        Overrides:
        beanFilters in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        append - If true, the previous value is appended to. Otherwise, the previous value is replaced.
        values - The new values for this property.
        Values can consist of any of the following types:
        • Any bean class that specifies a value for @Bean(typeName).
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryList containing a collection of bean classes with type name annotations.
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryMap containing a mapping of type names to classes without type name annotations.
        • Any array or collection of the objects above.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • beanFilters

        public JsonParserBuilder beanFilters(Object... values)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Bean filters.

        This is a programmatic equivalent to the @Bean annotation.
        It's useful when you want to use the Bean annotation functionality, but you don't have the ability to alter the bean classes.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters
        Overrides:
        beanFilters in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        values - The values to add to this property.
        Values can consist of any of the following types:
        • Any bean class that specifies a value for @Bean(typeName).
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryList containing a collection of bean classes with type name annotations.
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryMap containing a mapping of type names to classes without type name annotations.
        • Any array or collection of the objects above.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • beansRequireDefaultConstructor

        public JsonParserBuilder beansRequireDefaultConstructor(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Beans require no-arg constructors.

        If true, a Java class must implement a default no-arg constructor to be considered a bean.
        Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the Object.toString() method.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beansRequireDefaultConstructor
        Overrides:
        beansRequireDefaultConstructor in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        The default is false.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • beansRequireSettersForGetters

        public JsonParserBuilder beansRequireSettersForGetters(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Beans require setters for getters.

        If true, only getters that have equivalent setters will be considered as properties on a bean.
        Otherwise, they will be ignored.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beansRequireSettersForGetters
        Overrides:

      • beansRequireSomeProperties

        public JsonParserBuilder beansRequireSomeProperties(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Beans require at least one property.

        If true, then a Java class must contain at least 1 property to be considered a bean.
        Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the Object.toString() method.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beansRequireSomeProperties
        Overrides:
        beansRequireSomeProperties in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        The default is true.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • beanTypePropertyName

        public JsonParserBuilder beanTypePropertyName(String value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Bean type property name.

        This specifies the name of the bean property used to store the dictionary name of a bean type so that the parser knows the data type to reconstruct.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanTypePropertyName
        Overrides:
        beanTypePropertyName in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        The default is "_type".
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • pojoSwaps

        public JsonParserBuilder pojoSwaps(boolean append,
                                   Object... values)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: POJO swaps.

        POJO swaps are used to "swap out" non-serializable classes with serializable equivalents during serialization, and "swap in" the non-serializable class during parsing.

        An example of a POJO swap would be a Calendar object that gets swapped out for an ISO8601 string.

        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_pojoSwaps
        Overrides:
        pojoSwaps in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        append - If true, the previous value is appended to.
        Otherwise, the previous value is replaced.
        values - The new value for this property.
        Values can consist of any of the following types:
        • Strings.
        • Arrays and collections of strings.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • pojoSwaps

        public JsonParserBuilder pojoSwaps(Class<?>... values)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: POJO swaps.
        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_pojoSwaps
        Overrides:
        pojoSwaps in class ReaderParserBuilder

        values - The values to add to this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • pojoSwaps

        public JsonParserBuilder pojoSwaps(Object... values)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: POJO swaps.
        See Also:
        • BeanContext.BEAN_pojoSwaps
        Overrides:
        pojoSwaps in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        values - The values to add to this property.
        Values can consist of any of the following types:
        • Any subclass of PojoSwap.
        • Any surrogate class. A shortcut for defining a SurrogateSwap.
        • Any array or collection of the objects above.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • sortProperties

        public JsonParserBuilder sortProperties(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Sort bean properties.

        When true, all bean properties will be serialized and access in alphabetical order. Otherwise, the natural order of the bean properties is used which is dependent on the JVM vendor.

        • BeanContext.BEAN_sortProperties
        Overrides:
        sortProperties in class ReaderParserBuilder
        Parameters:

        The default is false.

        public JsonParserBuilder useJavaBeanIntrospector(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Use Java Introspector.

        Using the built-in Java bean introspector will not pick up fields or non-standard getters/setters.
